content: co2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co4 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co4 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo12 end of sequence work the sequence 5 more times heart of a snowflake by elena maltseva july 2025 important at the end of the last sequence bobble 11 instead of 12 after the last bind off you will have 1 stitch left on your rh needle next insert the needle into the 1st bound off stitch of the round and pull a new stitch through now slip the stitch from rh needle over it break yarn secure and weave in the ends heart of a snowflake by elena maltseva july 2025 stiffen and block out your snowflake
